meanings.definition: To swim faster than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the race, Sarah managed to outswim her competitors effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: Michael trained hard to outswim his friend in the pool.
meanings.sent3: The turtle challenged the rabbit to a race, confident that he could outswim him.
meanings.sent4: The cheetah can outswim most animals on land with its incredible speed.
meanings.sent5: In the ocean, the dolphin can outswim predators with its agility and grace.

meanings.sent1: The Olympic swimmer was determined to outswim her opponents and win the gold medal.
meanings.sent2: The shark can easily outswim its prey in the vast ocean.
meanings.sent3: The little fish tried to outswim the big fish, but it was no match for its speed.
meanings.sent4: The sailfish is known to outswim most other fish in the sea with its impressive speed.
meanings.sent5: The otter can outswim other animals in the water due to its streamlined body and powerful strokes.
